content.description: A nice plumb line up the overhanging West face. Sit start with hands matched on a perfect rail. Climb past another nice slanted rail and schist band to a hard deadpoint to the lip. Mantle over to the easy slab finish.
Start on the surprisingly good sidepull flake and crimp right, move up to the ledge, match and get a high heel to top. Short and sweet like BBQ sauce
content.location: Front of the boulder, tucked into the rocky corner by Hog Wall

content.description: Sustained crimper climbing on a slightly overhanging face with a couple larger reaches. Sit start on the right facing, right angling, undercling rail. Work up the underclings then out left to a slopey crimp rail. Work your way straight up from here. Easy top out.
content.protection: Four pads at least is nice.
content.location: Center of the overhanging face just left of Ultimate Porker.

content.description: A hog of a line. Very pumpy lip traverse. Stand start at the bottom of the boulder where the crescent rail begins. Shuffle up and left for the entire length of the boulder, topping out at the very corner.Â
content.protection: Lots of pads. The ground somewhat parallels the lip, so you're never too high but the terrain gets rocky.
content.location: Start at lowest point of the boulder and climb the West lip.

content.description: Cool and comfy holds with a perfect starting jug but climbs a little awkwardly in the beginning. Sit start on the obvious jug rail and make a couple moves out left to the arete. Then straight up to finish.
content.location: Far left side (uphill end) of the overhanging West face.

content.description: Large block about a fifty yards up the hill from the road. Identifiable by the long clean rail on its West side.
